task_name: Configure Gemini AI Analysis for CV Screening Optimization
context: for optimized CV screening accuracy and consistency
description: Fine-tune Gemini AI analysis parameters, prompts, and scoring criteria to achieve >95% CV screening accuracy. Includes prompt engineering for 21-field extraction, scoring calibration, and bias reduction. Part of Week 1 implementation following n8n setup.
dependencies: 10+ sample CVs for testing and calibration
success_criteria: Gemini AI consistently extracts all 21 fields with >95% accuracy
Scoring algorithm validated against manual HR review (>90% agreement)
Bias reduction confirmed (tested across diverse candidate profiles)
Zero critical errors in 50-CV test batch

steps.name: Load CV Parser v1 prompt into n8n workflow
inputs: CV Parser v1 prompt text from PRM-HR-001
outputs: Dynamic variables configured for CV text insertion
steps.success_criteria: Prompt correctly formatted in n8n with {{CV_text}} variable placeholder

steps.name: Configure Gemini AI model parameters
steps.success_criteria: Parameters set for consistent, structured output with minimal hallucination

steps.name: Test AI with 5 known-good CVs (baseline validation)
inputs: 5 pre-screened CVs with manually verified data
outputs: Comparison table: AI vs Manual extraction
steps.success_criteria: >90% field accuracy across all 5 CVs (95+ out of 105 fields correct)

steps.name: Refine prompt based on error patterns
inputs: Common extraction failures (e.g., phone formats, date parsing, skill lists)
outputs: Explicit formatting rules for TSV output
steps.success_criteria: Prompt updated to address >80% of identified errors

steps.name: Add scoring criteria to AI prompt
inputs: Scoring rubric: Experience (0-30 pts), Education (0-20 pts), Skills (0-30 pts), Language (0-10 pts), Availability (0-10 pts)
outputs: Total score field (0-100) added as 22nd output field
steps.success_criteria: AI generates consistent scores aligned with HR evaluation criteria

steps.name: Test with diverse candidate profiles for bias detection
inputs: 10 CVs with diverse characteristics: gender, age, nationality, career gaps, non-traditional backgrounds
outputs: Statistical check for unfair scoring patterns
steps.success_criteria: No statistically significant bias detected across protected characteristics (p>0.05)

steps.name: Calibrate scoring against manual HR reviews
inputs: 20 CVs scored by both AI and manual HR review
steps.success_criteria: >90% agreement on Interview/Reject decisions, correlation coefficient >0.85

steps.name: Document final configuration and create prompt version control
steps.success_criteria: Configuration fully documented, reproducible by other team members

Final configuration documented with version control

troubleshooting.issue: AI extracts wrong phone number format
troubleshooting.solution: Add explicit instruction: 'Extract phone in international format: +XX-XXX-XXX-XXXX'
Increase max tokens to 3000, add instruction: 'Extract ALL skills mentioned, separate with commas'
Add examples in prompt: 'Parse dates as YYYY-MM-DD. Example: Jan 2020 â†’ 2020-01-01'

troubleshooting.issue: Scores vary widely for similar candidates
troubleshooting.solution: Add anchor examples in prompt: 'Score 80-90: 5+ years relevant experience, degree in field, fluent English'

troubleshooting.issue: AI hallucinates information not in CV
troubleshooting.solution: Lower temperature to 0.1, add instruction: 'ONLY extract information explicitly stated. Use N/A for missing fields'

optimization_tips: Use few-shot examples (2-3 sample CVs with perfect output) in prompt
Test prompt changes with same 10 CVs for consistent comparison
Monitor Gemini API usage to stay within free tier (60 requests/minute)
Create A/B test: run same CVs with old vs new prompt, compare accuracy
Use Google Sheets formulas to auto-calculate accuracy percentages
Set up weekly calibration: HR reviews 10 random AI-scored CVs for drift detection
bias_prevention_checklist: Remove or anonymize name field before scoring (if gender bias detected)
Test scoring consistency across different universities (avoid prestige bias)
Validate scoring for candidates with career gaps (avoid recency bias)
Check scoring for international candidates (avoid nationality bias)
Test with non-traditional career paths (avoid traditional employment bias)

Candidate anonymization before AI analysis (blind screening)
Continuous learning: update prompt based on hiring outcome data
Custom skill taxonomy integration (match against company-specific skill database)
